instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: SECO STAATSSEKRETARIAT FÜR WIRTSCHAFT - INTERNATIONALE ARBEITSFRAGEN DAIN. Summary: National Action Plan on Business and Human Rights 2024-2027. Description: Objective: To promote dialogue between stakeholders in order to strengthen the implementation of human rights in the practices of Swiss companies. Activities: · (Measure 3) Organise the third national forum on business and human rights in 2026 and roundtable discussions involving companies, academia, non-governmental organisations, the public sector and international organisations. · (Measure 5 reinforced) Ensuring the transfer of knowledge and best practices between the various actors. In doing so: o Promote dialogue between stakeholders, including business associations and civil society, by supporting roundtable discussions and discussion platforms. The aim is to promote constructive cooperation by developing practical solutions for better respect for human rights in business activities. The focus here is primarily on multi-stakeholder initiatives in the cocoa, gold, sustainable textiles and coffee sectors, as well as on the implementation of the Voluntary Principles on Security and Human Rights and the International Code of Conduct for Private Security Service Providers, in which Switzerland already plays an active role. <br> Doc Title: National Action Plan on Business and Human Rights 2024-2027 <br> Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2025-07-28. Closing Date: 2025-09-08. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Purchaser_Name: SECO STAATSSEKRETARIAT FÜR WIRTSCHAFT - INTERNATIONALE ARBEITSFRAGEN DAIN
output.Summary: National Action Plan on Business and Human Rights 2024-2027
output.Description: Objective: To promote dialogue between stakeholders in order to strengthen the implementation of human rights in the practices of Swiss companies. Activities: · (Measure 3) Organise the third national forum on business and human rights in 2026 and roundtable discussions involving companies, academia, non-governmental organisations, the public sector and international organisations. · (Measure 5 reinforced) Ensuring the transfer of knowledge and best practices between the various actors. In doing so: o Promote dialogue between stakeholders, including business associations and civil society, by supporting roundtable discussions and discussion platforms. The aim is to promote constructive cooperation by developing practical solutions for better respect for human rights in business activities. The focus here is primarily on multi-stakeholder initiatives in the cocoa, gold, sustainable textiles and coffee sectors, as well as on the implementation of the Voluntary Principles on Security and Human Rights and the International Code of Conduct for Private Security Service Providers, in which Switzerland already plays an active role. <br> Doc Title: National Action Plan on Business and Human Rights 2024-2027 <br> Contract Type: services
output.Sub_Sector: Legal, Marketing, Consulting and Recruitment Services

input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: FEDERAL OFFICE OF ROADS ASTRA - DEPARTMENT OF STRASSE INFRASTRUCTURE WEST - BRANCH THUN. Summary: N00.F2-025 160071 - Framework Contracts F2 - Framework Contracts Project Generations Bsa Los 1 Canton of Bern (Id 11275) and Los 2 Kanton Valais (Id 11276). Description: The Federal Office of Strassen (Astra) branch intends to conclude two framework contracts with a term of five years. The subject is the project generations and state summits of the operating and security equipment (BSA) on the national roads of the area units I and III (Kantone Bern and Valais). The framework contracts enable rapid and competitive allocation of the specific services within the framework of mini tenders among the award recipients. A maximum of three providers are taken into account per lot.<br> The first framework contract concerns area unit I (Canton of Bern), the second the area unit III (canton of Valais).<br> The providers must provide a pool of experienced project managers, supported by a Specialized team. Depending on the location of the infrastructure, the services are performed in German or French.<br> N00.F2-025 160071 - Framework contracts F2 - Framework contracts Project generations BSA Los 1 Canton of Bern (ID 11275)<br> Lot 1 canton of Bern:<br> Provision of services for Project generations and condition versions on the perimeter of area unit I (framework contract)<br> N00.F2-025 160071 - Framework contracts F2 - Framework contracts Project generations BSA Los 2 Canton of Valais (ID 11276)<br> Lot 2 canton of Valais:<br> Provision of services for project generations and Condition substance .... Published Date: 2025-07-04. Closing Date: 2025-09-01. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: UNIVERSITÄT ZÜRICH ASSETMANAGEMENT. Summary: Cro Services Pool. Description: UZH invites companies to submit competitive offers for the following procurement need: CRO services for compound synthesis, ADME, PK and non-GLP tox studies. Recolony specializes in the identification of new disease targets through in-depth analysis of the host-microbiota interactions. For the present project, Recolony is developing a novel small molecule immunotherapy for cancer. For this purpose, Recolony is looking for CRO support for compound synthesis, ADME (Absorption, Distribution, Metabolism, and Excretion) and PK (pharmacokinetics) studies, non-GLP tox studies and in vivo efficacy studies. The exact work packages that are needed cannot be defined upfront due to the exploratory nature of the project. Therefore, this public tender is evaluating CROs to become members in a pool of framework agreement partners by passing a suitability check and signing a Master Service Agreement (MSA). Members within that pool can apply for work packages thereafter via the process of mini tender. These work packages will be defined and tendered on an ongoing basis for the duration of the project. <br> Doc Title: CRO Services Pool <br> Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2025-05-14. Closing Date: 2025-06-23. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Description: UZH invites companies to submit competitive offers for the following procurement need: CRO services for compound synthesis, ADME, PK and non-GLP tox studies. Recolony specializes in the identification of new disease targets through in-depth analysis of the host-microbiota interactions. For the present project, Recolony is developing a novel small molecule immunotherapy for cancer. For this purpose, Recolony is looking for CRO support for compound synthesis, ADME (Absorption, Distribution, Metabolism, and Excretion) and PK (pharmacokinetics) studies, non-GLP tox studies and in vivo efficacy studies. The exact work packages that are needed cannot be defined upfront due to the exploratory nature of the project. Therefore, this public tender is evaluating CROs to become members in a pool of framework agreement partners by passing a suitability check and signing a Master Service Agreement (MSA). Members within that pool can apply for work packages thereafter via the process of mini tender. These work packages will be defined and tendered on an ongoing basis for the duration of the project. <br> Doc Title: CRO Services Pool <br> Contract Type: services
